Posts.Content: maccupiccu wrote: Hi, This is for my mom but I'm curious since the oncologist can't give us answers.  My mom has been fighting stage IV metastatic breast cancer (spine, spleen, liver) for 6 years with suprising results. This January, however, she acquired pneumonia and has never felt the same. The doc(s) said it takes time but I"m seeing a huge difference in her demenor and quality of life (Before pneumonia--very mobile. After--very weak beyond words). She couldn't take chemo in Jan. due to low white cell count (and then got pneumonia). Now that she's feeling so bad, oncologist said take another month off. We went for her labs this past weekend to see where she is at with things but to me, I'm not so confident this is pneumonia recovery and even if so, what can we expect with a two month break from chemo? She was on zometa and navelbine. When I talked with a sub oncologist in the hospital asking if she stopped chemo what would happen, he said she would have weeks to a few months left. That sounds "reasonable" to me. But her own oncologist just leaves us with "we don't know what will happen."  Any insight would help me understand and prepare. Log in to post a reply
